enb_long_title: Thirty-second Session of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC)
section_title: Recommendations and decisions on a procedure for the handling of potential errors identified after approval of IPCC reports
sentences: Delegates noted that this was addressed in the IAC Review, which included analysis of the Himalayan glacier error, but did not result in an explicit recommendation by the IAC.
There was broad consensus that a procedure to address errors was essential.

While emphasizing the need to minimize errors and noting that current procedures are designed to do just that, many agreed that errors are bound to occur in a process as large and as complex as the IPCC reports.

Delegates noted the proposed IPCC protocol for addressing errors in previous assessment reports (IPCC-XXXII/INF.8) and noted the need to avoid bias and to address errors as rapidly as possible after they have been identified.
